title: MacOS Media Controls Not Working
content: On MacOS, latest version of Big Sur, and latest Firefox and Firefox Nightly (tested both), media controls are not working as intended. I have media controls enabled in the options:config, and every other browser I have (Safari, Chrome) work perfectly fine. I tested on a few sites such as Youtube, Youtube Music, etc. The only information Firefox passes to the OS's media center (now playing in the menu bar) is the name of the video, but not the time / current time / album art. I really rely on this for controlling my music, so any help would be appreciated =)
creator: zachdevv

title: Thunderbird and Firefox don't save login and password for proxy
content:
Hello and thanks for your attention.

I have problem with Firefox and Thunderbird after new Windows 10 installation. I receive "Authentication Required" window, one with "User password Manager to remember this password" checkbox and one without it. I enter my username and password and make sure checkbox is checked. Proxy works perfectly but after program reload i receive authentication windows with empty username and password inputs. I solved this problem in Firefox with FoxyProxy extension but I can't solve it in Thunderbird.

I also have KeePassXC. Tried to delete it but this doesn't help.

Windows 10 version - 21H1 (19043.1165) Firefox version - 92.0 Thunderbird version - 91.1.0
creator: GreezXII

title: How can I backup Firefox 92.xxx (not by syncing to another computer)
content:
There used to be plugins in much older version of FFox, but those days are gone. I understand that the Sync function allows sharing of login/passwords between several machines, but is there any way to simply backup login/passwords of one computer that does not share anything with any other computer. There does not seem to be any way to do this -searching FFox help yields nothing.

Sometimes, the simple ways work well, and this would be such an occasion. This function ought to be built in to every software program, but unfortunately this does not happen.

Thanks for reading

Windows 10 latest FFox 64 bit latest
creator: drdancmm

title: STOP forcing browser/plugin/extensions to run: Google, Bing, Amazon, DuckDuckGo, eBay, Wikipedia, and whatever else you are forcing down our throats
content:
Several people have complained and NOBODY is listening. I specifically switched to FF so I don't have to deal with intrusive sites. FF I thought claimed to be UNLIKE GOOGLE and was more "private," so why are you putting in a Google browser/plugin/extension and forcing it to run on our PC's? I have enough crap on it taking up MEMORY and slowing it down, don't force anything people do NOT want. Just because these might be popular with many does NOT mean everybody wants it. Get rid of Google, Bing, Amazon, DuckDuckGo, eBay, Wikipedia, and WHATEVER else you are forcing us to run on FF.

Does FF have an agreement or partnering with these companies to TRACK US where ever we go on the internet? Looks like it. Per Wikipedia: DuckDuckGo earns revenue by serving ads from the Yahoo-Bing search alliance network and through affiliate relationships with Amazon and eBay. OK, so we have 4 of those And this at https://www.comparitech.com/blog/vpn-privacy/best-private-search-engine: DuckDuckGo displays ads for affiliate sites in the right sidebar, which is a little less aggressive than Google which presents ads at the top of search results. It earns additional profits from commissions from sites like Amazon and eBay, so you may want to be wary if those pop up a lot in search results. Also: As DuckDuckGo’s CEO, Gabriel Weinberg, explains in a Quora answer, the search engine does use your IP address to serve local results.

Why is FF pushing these sites when many of us do NOT use them nor want them? Why don't you add them as extensions where you can CHOOSE it if you wish? I found instructions on how to delete them in the FF File Explorer folder because merely deleting them in Settings does NOT remove them permanently as FF has them "hidden," however, they just come back and it messed up other add-ons. ALSO, these add-on's you are forcing on us is TAKING SPACE on my PC and I resent that.

I do NOT want to HIDE THEM, I want them REMOVED PERMANENTLY.
creator: jj

title: Firefox Updated in the Background Error
content:
For some reason I keep getting an error screen that says Firefox updated in the background and needs to be restarted, and each time it does that I get logged out and lose all my tabs and have to continuously sign in to my Firefox account and any other accounts I use on a regular.

This issue has been since late August and I've tried deleting and redownloading Firefox as well as switching to "check for updates but let you install them" in the settings.

Any additional help would be great since this issue is getting in the way of my work... When this first happened I didn't have a firefox account and lost all my bookmarks and had to sign into every single account.. I've learned from that initial moment.
creator: kennedy.a.patterson

title: Website Fonts have a Black Stroke/Outline
content:
Some sites like OP.GG have a black stroke on letters. I've already looked at other forums and options.


Settings > Language and Appearance > Fonts and Colors > Advanced > Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of your selections above. This method does not work along with disabling high contrast (disabled already)

Any sort of help would be appreciated except telling me what I already did. Thank you
creator: aggrodzn

title: Firefox is screwing up my Firefox
content:
Running Windows 7 Pro with Firefox 92.0(64-bit). Once 2 days ago and just within the last 30 minutes I opened Firefox. Instead of opening to my homepage, I got a new Firefox page (white background) asking me something which I really didn't care about. Instead of wasting my time I clicked the Home icon and went to my Homepage (Yahoo by the way). The first time it happened (2 days ago) it separated all of my favorites with one line in between each, turned everything in the favorites white (no color). A pain in the ass to work with, so I finally did a rollback of the OS to August 30th, and then everything was OK. The Firefox experience just repeated itself 30 minutes ago and boy am I pissed. The same thing happened to my Favorites sections. What is going on and how can I fix it without doing an OS rollback ? 

                                                                                                       Thanks, Sam G
creator: sg23p7

title: Moderators: Yes, Users Still Hate Proton
content:
This thread will probably be locked, but I'm going to post it anyway, so that it can be seen by other users who agree. To summarize:

1. @cor_el, you've been particularly helpful in the past, and I value your input whether or not I agree with your responses, and whether you post those responses as a user or in your official capacity as moderator. 2. Users still hate Proton--the lack of contrast and the inability to reposition pop-up windows in particular. 3. User feedback matters. 4. I will not register for a third-party app simply to give direct feedback to Mozilla. Companies need to increase their capacity to engage with customers directly. Without customers, a company spits into the wind. 5. While I am proficient at a number of technology skills, I do not have the capacity to master CSS.

Thank you. ajk1962f
creator: ajk1962f
